title: Cole Pulice Announces New Album Land’s End Eternal, Shares New Song “After the Rain”: Listen
description: The composer and multi-instrumentalist’s first studio LP for Leaving Records arrives in May
author: Nina Corcoran
excerpt: The composer and multi-instrumentalist’s first studio LP for Leaving Records arrives in May
text: The composer and multi-instrumentalist’s first studio LP for Leaving Records arrives in MayCole Pulice, the Minneapolis-raised composer and electroacoustic saxophonist now based in Oakland, California, has announced their first new solo album in three years. The follow-up to 2022’s Scry is titled Land’s End Eternal and is due out May 9 via Leaving. Pulice has shared the lead single from the LP, “After the Rain,” a nine-minute piece featuring the voice of Maria BC. Listen to it below.For Land’s End Eternal, Pulice incorporated electric guitar into their work for the first time. “I’ve always loved the electric guitar but never owned one, so it quickly became an important part of my daily music routine and explorations, and ultimately a compositional centerpiece for the work on Land’s End Eternal,” they said.Land’s End Eternal follows two recent full-length collaborations between Pulice and ambient musician Lynn Avery: 2024’s Phantasy & Reality and 2022’s To Live & Die in Space & Time.Revisit the Rising interview “Cole Pulice’s Ambient Saxophone Multiverse” and read about “If I Don’t See You in the Future, I’ll See You in the Pasture” on “The 100 Best Songs of the 2020s So Far.”Land’s End Eternal:01 Fragments of a Slipstream Dream02 In a Hidden Nook Between Worlds I03 In a Hidden Nook Between Worlds II04 In a Hidden Nook Between Worlds III05 In This & Every Life06 After the RainNina Corcoran joined Pitchfork as an Associate Staff Writer in 2021 after contributing to the website since 2015. html:
The composer and multi-instrumentalist’s first studio LP for Leaving Records arrives in May

Cole Pulice, the Minneapolis-raised composer and electroacoustic saxophonist now based in Oakland, California, has announced their first new solo album in three years. The follow-up to 2022’s Scry is titled Land’s End Eternal and is due out May 9 via Leaving. Pulice has shared the lead single from the LP, “After the Rain,” a nine-minute piece featuring the voice of Maria BC. Listen to it below.

For Land’s End Eternal, Pulice incorporated electric guitar into their work for the first time. “I’ve always loved the electric guitar but never owned one, so it quickly became an important part of my daily music routine and explorations, and ultimately a compositional centerpiece for the work on Land’s End Eternal,” they said.

Land’s End Eternal follows two recent full-length collaborations between Pulice and ambient musician Lynn Avery: 2024’s Phantasy & Reality and 2022’s To Live & Die in Space & Time.

Revisit the Rising interview “Cole Pulice’s Ambient Saxophone Multiverse” and read about “If I Don’t See You in the Future, I’ll See You in the Pasture” on “The 100 Best Songs of the 2020s So Far.”

Land’s End Eternal:

01 Fragments of a Slipstream Dream
02 In a Hidden Nook Between Worlds I
03 In a Hidden Nook Between Worlds II
04 In a Hidden Nook Between Worlds III
05 In This & Every Life
06 After the Rain

Nina Corcoran joined Pitchfork as an Associate Staff Writer in 2021 after contributing to the website since 2015. She’s written for Rolling Stone, Wired, NPR, Stereogum, and elsewhere, and was previously the music editor of alt-weekly newspaper DigBoston. She’s based in Chicago. ... Read more
